00010 // things that I can't put into nice meaningful classes
00011 class Game
00012 {
00013 public:
00014         // the game's own rounding function
00015         // infamous for true'ing (F2I(-5.00) == -4.00)
00016         static __int64 F2I(double val) {
00017 #ifdef _MSVC
00018                 double something = val;
00019                 __asm { fld something };
00020                 CALL(0x7C5F00);
00021 #endif
00022         }
00023 
00024         static void RaiseError(HRESULT err)
00025                 { JMP_STD(0x7DC720); }

00389 class MovieInfo
00390 {
00391         public:
00392                 char *Name; // yes, only that
00393                 static DynamicVectorClass<MovieInfo> *Array;
00394 
00395         bool operator== (MovieInfo &rhs)
00396                 { return !strcmp(rhs.Name, this->Name); }
00397 
00398         MovieInfo(const char *fname)
00399                 { this->Name = _strdup(fname); }
00400 
00401         MovieInfo()
00402                 {}
00403 
00404         ~MovieInfo()
00405                 { delete this->Name; }

00453 struct ColorPacker

00463         static ColorPacker *ColorPackData = (ColorPacker *)0x8A0DD0;
00464 
00465         static CellStruct *CellSpreadTable = (CellStruct *)0xABD490;
00466 
00467         static int &CurrentSWType = *(int *)0x8809A0;
00468 
00469         static const int except_txt_length = 0xFFFF;
00470         static char *except_txt_content = (char *)0x8A3A08;
00471 
00472 /*
00473  * This thing is ridiculous
00474  * all xxTypeClass::Create functions use it:
00475 
00476   // doing this makes no sense - it's just a wrapper around CTOR, which doesn't call any Mutex'd functions... but who cares
00477   InfantryTypeClass *foo = something;
00478   ++SomeMutex;
00479   InfantryClass *obj = foo->CreateObject();
00480   --SomeMutex;
00481 
00482   // XXX do not do this if you aren't sure if the object can exist in this place
00483   // - this flag overrides any placement checks so you can put Terror Drones into trees and stuff
00484   ++SomeMutex;
00485   obj->Put(blah);
00486   --SomeMutex;
00487 
00488   AI base node generation uses it:
00489   int level = SomeMutex;
00490   SomeMutex = 0;
00491   House->GenerateAIBuildList();
00492   SomeMutex = level;
00493 
00494   Building destruction uses it:
00495   if(!SomeMutex) {
00496         Building->ShutdownSensorArray();
00497         Building->ShutdownDisguiseSensor();
00498   }
00499 
00500   Building placement uses it:
00501   if(!SomeMutex) {
00502         UnitTypeClass *freebie = Building->Type->FreeUnit;
00503         if(freebie) {
00504                 freebie->CreateObject(blah);
00505         }
00506   }
00507 
00508   Building state animations use it:
00509   if(SomeMutex) {
00510         // foreach attached anim
00511         // update anim state (normal | damaged | garrisoned) if necessary, play anim
00512   }
00513 
00514   building selling uses it:
00515   if(blah) {
00516         ++SomeMutex;
00517         this->Type->UndeploysInto->CreateAtMapCoords(blah);
00518         --SomeMutex;
00519   }
00520 
00521   Robot Control Centers use it:
00522   if ( !SomeMutex ) {
00523         VoxClass::PlayFromName("EVA_RobotTanksOffline/BackOnline", -1, -1);
00524   }
00525 
00526   and so on...
00527  */
00528         // Note: SomeMutex has been renamed to this because it reflects the usage better
00529         static int &IKnowWhatImDoing = *(int *)0xA8E7AC; // h2ik
00530 };
